wikipedia_page.main:
Mick Baxter (born 30 December 1956 – 16 January 1989) was an English footballer who played as a defender for Preston North End, Middlesbrough and Portsmouth
He died of cancer in January 1989, aged 32.

link_mentions.page: Preston North End F.C. Player of the Year
History of Preston North End F.C.
response: Promotion was won under Nobby Stiles in 1977–78, inspired by the likes of goalkeeper Roy Tunks, defender Mick Baxter, midfielder Gordon Coleman and the dynamic strike force of Alex Bruce and Mike Elwiss. At the same time the emerging Michael Robinson was sold for a club record fee of £765,000 to Manchester City, whilst Alan Spavin retired.
